Sports AI Terms of Service and Privacy Notice

 

Effective Date: 01/11/2024

Welcome to Sports AI! These Terms of Service, End User License Agreement (Global), and Privacy Notice outline the rules, guidelines, and responsibilities for accessing and using Sports AI’s platform and services.

1. Introduction

This Privacy Notice explains what personal information we collect, how we collect it, and why we use it when you interact with Sports AI through our online platform, mobile app, or any other digital interface. Please read this notice carefully to understand how we process your data and your rights under these policies.

This Privacy Notice applies globally to all Sports AI platforms and services, and it is compliant with applicable international data protection laws. Sports AI is the data controller for the following services:

  • Sports AI Website
  • Sports AI App
  • Sports AI Membership Services

If you have any questions, please reach out to us via the contact information provided at the end of this document.

2. What Personal Data Do We Collect?

We collect the following categories of personal data when you interact with the Sports AI platform:

2.1 Account Information

  • Email address, password, and username used to create an account.
  • Information from third-party login services (e.g., social media accounts).

2.2 Preferences and Profile Data

  • Viewing history, sports preferences, and account settings.
  • User activity data, such as navigation and viewing duration.

2.3 Device and Browser Data

  • Device type, IP address, operating system, and crash reports.

2.4 Cookies and Tracking

  • Cookies, web beacons, and similar technologies to track user behavior and enhance functionality.

2.5 Support Information

  • Records of your interactions with customer support, including chat and email transcripts.

2.6 Children’s Data

  • Users under the age of 18 may only use Sports AI under the supervision of a parent or guardian.

3. Why Do We Process Your Data?

We process your personal data for the following purposes:

  1. Providing Services: To authenticate your account, tailor content to your preferences, and manage your membership.
  2. Improving Services: To conduct research, analytics, and usability testing to enhance the user experience.
  3. Marketing: To send personalized recommendations, promotions, and targeted advertisements.
  4. Compliance: To comply with legal obligations and respond to government or legal requests.
  5. Fraud Prevention: To detect and mitigate fraudulent or illegal activities.

4. Who Do We Share Your Data With?

Your personal data may be shared with:

  • Service Providers: Hosting, security, payment processing, and marketing partners.
  • Affiliates: Other entities under the Sports AI group for operational purposes.
  • Legal Authorities: When required by law or to protect Sports AI’s rights and users.
  • Business Transfers: In the event of mergers, acquisitions, or asset transfers.

5. Your Rights

As a user, you have the following rights regarding your data:

  • Access: Request details about the data we process about you.
  • Rectification: Update or correct your personal data.
  • Erasure: Request deletion of your data, subject to legal obligations.
  • Portability: Receive your data in a machine-readable format.
  • Withdraw Consent: Revoke consent for marketing or other optional data processing.
  • Object: Challenge data processing based on legitimate interests.

For assistance in exercising these rights, contact our support team.

6. Data Retention

We retain your personal data as long as your account is active and as required for legal or operational purposes. Upon account termination, your data will be deleted unless required for compliance, fraud prevention, or dispute resolution.

7. Cookies and Tracking

We use cookies and similar technologies to:

  • Enable essential platform functionality.
  • Analyze performance and improve user experience.
  • Deliver personalized advertisements and content.

You can manage cookie preferences through your browser settings. Note that disabling cookies may affect platform functionality.

8. Security

Sports AI takes data security seriously and implements technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data from unauthorized access, loss, or misuse.

9. Changes to the Terms

We may update these Terms and Privacy Notice from time to time. Significant changes will be communicated to users, and continued use of the platform implies acceptance of any updates.

10. Contact Us

If you have questions about these Terms or Privacy Notice, please contact us at:
Sports AI Support

Alpha2 OTT Privacy Policy

Alpha2 OTT is strongly committed to protecting our users’ privacy when our users interact with our website,our content, products and services. Pixellot Demo aims to provide our users with experiences that inform, entertainand educate. To customize that experience, sometimes we use the information that you provide with the sole objectiveto improve the quality of your experience. We are committed to transparency regarding how and why we collect and useyour information. In some cases, if you do not want us to collect or use your information in a particular way, then wewill give you the opportunity to say so.

The purpose of this Privacy Policy is to explain:

- The application of this Privacy Policy

- the kind of information the Alpha2 OTT Ltd may collect about you, how we collect it, and how we use it

- how we may disclose that information

- how you can access the information we hold about you

- when we may use your information to contact you

- the protection of your personal information

- Alpha2 OTT’s use of cookies to collect information, and how you can control or delete these cookies

- additional steps to protect young people

- how and why we collect and use additional information when you visit the Alpha2 OTT Portal

1. Application of this Privacy Policy

The Alpha2 OTT Privacy Policy applies to personal information collected by the Alpha2 OTT, whether wehave asked for the information or not. This policy applies only to the Alpha2 OTT. It does not apply to anyother company or organization, including those whose digital services have links to Alpha2 OTT’s content orservices. Third party services which have links to Alpha2 OTT’s content or services will govern the use ofpersonal information you submit to them. This information may also be collected by cookies when you visit or use anyof the platforms within the Alpha2 OTT stable of digital platforms. We do not accept any responsibility orliability for the privacy practices of such third party digital services.

Alpha2 OTT will review this policy regularly, and may update it from time to time. If we make changes, we willpost those changes on the privacy page of the Alpha2 OTT website.

2. Collection and use of personal information

2.1 Why we collect personal information 

Alpha2 OTT collects personal information about you:

- Because you have provided it to us. For instance if you contact us to make comments, complaints or to ask usquestions, or you have interacted with one of our digital services (including online and mobile services), forinstance by participating in forums, polls or competitions;

- Because we need the information to provide a product or service that you have requested. For instance, if yousubscribe to an email list or loyalty program, enter a competition, or purchase products from any of the platformswhich fall under the Alpha2 OTT digital stable;

- Because we would like to improve our services. For instance Alpha2 OTT will constantly strive toimprove our digital offering through the collection and analysis of statistical and research data.

2.2 How we collect information when you use a digital service (including online and mobile services)

Broadly, there are two types of information or data we collect:

For example, you may provide information about yourself when you are filling in a form or when you sign up to aservice. This type of information may include your name, email address and age. The information that you give us maybe:

- Personal information that is required. In some instances, you must provide personal information if you wish touse a particular service or participate in an activity. For example, your age may be required if we need toconfirm that you are old enough to use a particular service.

- Personal information that is optional. You may choose to provide some personal information which is notrequired but is directly related to Alpha2 OTT’s functions or activities. Usually this type of informationwill enable Alpha2 OTT to improve or broaden the services we can offer you. If you choose not to providethis optional information, we will still be able to offer you the service, but perhaps with fewer options than ifyou had provided this optional information.

- Permissions. Sometimes you will be asked to confirm that you agree to a particular activity. For example, youmay need to expressly agree to the terms and conditions of service.

You may be able to make changes to the information you provided to us. For example, if you change your email addressor withdraw the permission you gave us for a particular service. We will make it clear how you can do that.

ii. Data we collect that tracks your activity

Alpha2 OTT automatically gathers information to monitor the use of its digital services- (including online andmobile services). For example, the numbers and frequency of visitors to Alpha2 OTT’s digital platforms. Thisinformation helps us improve our services by learning what our audiences use and don’t use. It can also help usidentify if there are any problems with our services that need fixing. Most of the data we collect is aggregated, andthis information is effectively anonymous to us.

In some cases we may collect data that can be linked to you individually. For example, when you log in to any of theAlpha2 OTT’s digital platforms as a registered user, we may store records of information such as the commentsyou make, the pages you viewed or links you click on. As well as helping to improve our services, we may use this datato provide recommendations that you might find helpful based on your activity. In some cases, a digital profile may beformed based on your activity. We gather this information in order to improve the user experience. For instance,because some services may allow you to build a profile which earns different privileges that enhances the userexperience; or to improve our ability to provide a service.

Though surveys usually collect aggregate data, we will make it clear to you if any survey information is beingcollected in a way that could personally identify you.

3. Disclosure of personal information

3.1 Disclosure of personal information to third parties 

Alpha2 OTT may disclose your personal information to third parties for the following purposes:

- to provide the service you wish to use;

- for research purposes relating to the performance, quality, maintenance and improvement of services andproducts;

- to customize and promote services which may be of interest to you;

- to provide technical support for you to use the services;

- if permitted or required by law; or

- Otherwise with your consent.

Alpha2 OTT is assisted by a variety of third parties to deliver the services offered. These third parties maychange from time to time. Some examples of the types of third parties include:

- Technology service providers

- Marketing service providers

- Subscription services providers

In many cases, Alpha2 OTT imposes contractual restrictions equivalent to those imposed onAlpha2 OTT under the Protection of Personal Information and Privacy Act, in respect of collection and use ofpersonal information by those third parties. In some cases, such as social media networks, Alpha2 OTT’sability to impose contractual restrictions is limited. In those circumstances, Alpha2 OTT will carefullyconsider the risks to the protection of personal information when entering into arrangements with third parties.

Alpha2 OTT may disclose your personal information (excluding sensitive information about you) to third partiesfor the purposes of directly marketing Alpha2 OTT’s services. Alpha2 OTT will obtain your specificconsent to disclose sensitive information for the purposes of directly marketing Alpha2 OTT’s services. Youwill be able to opt-out of direct marketing at any time if you so choose.

Under no circumstances will Alpha2 OTT sell or receive payment for licensing or disclosing your personalinformation.

3.2 Information that you disclose publicly

Alpha2 OTT provides content and services on a range of platforms with interactive features that you cancontribute to. When using digital services, (including online and mobile services), we suggest that you use yourdiscretion and exercise caution when providing your personal information. For instance, if you 'share' informationthat you have posted on Alpha2 OTT’s platform using a social media tool, it is likely that you will be sharingyour personal information. Alpha2 OTT has limited capacity to protect personal information that you choose toshare in this way.

Note that whenever you post personal information in publicly accessible places, such as chat rooms or message boards,this information becomes available to anyone with access to the internet. This information can be collected and usedby others. In short, if you post personal information online (such as your contact details), you may receive unwantedmessages from other parties in return. Therefore, we recommend that you refrain from posting any information that youdo not want seen in these public areas.

Ultimately, you are responsible for maintaining the secrecy of your passwords and/or any personal information. Beresponsible whenever you are online or use a digital service.

3.3 Information that is disclosed via other platforms or services

Some Alpha2 OTT services may be integrated with external services, including social media networks. This maymean that information, for instance about your interests and activities, is tracked or extracted from other platforms(such as Facebook). If you are signed in to Alpha2 OTT’s digital platform that is integrated with other mediatools, this information may be available to others depending on the privacy settings you have in place on these otherplatforms.

The number and nature of social media platforms is changing rapidly, and the way in which information is sharedbetween them is becoming increasingly complex. To help you manage and protect your personal information, Pixellot DemoLtd Media Group will ask you to opt-in before making your personal information available through an integratedservice. You may also opt-out of your participation in most of Alpha2 OTT’s digital services. Informationabout how to opt-out will be provided in the particular service. However, you should be aware thatAlpha2 OTT may continue to store personal information provided by you prior to you opting-out.

Your ability to opt-out of a third party tool or platform will depend on the conditions governing your agreement withthat third party.

4. Accessing your personal information

You have the right to request access to your personal information that is held by Alpha2 OTT about you.Requests for access will be dealt with by Alpha2 OTT in accordance with the Protection of Personal Informationand Privacy Act.

You also have the right to request the correction of any of your personal information that Pixellot Demo Ltd MediaGroup holds. Alpha2 OTT will take reasonable steps to make appropriate corrections to personal information sothat it is accurate, complete and up-to-date.

5. Use of your personal information to contact you

We may use information that we know about your likes and interests to tell you about other Pixellot Demo Ltd MediaGroup offerings, programs, products and services when you are online. We may know about your likes and interestsbecause you have provided that information, for instance via a social media platform, or because we have inferred thisbased on your browsing history, or other data related to your behaviour on digital services.

6. Protection of your personal information

Alpha2 OTT will take all reasonable and practicable steps to ensure that your personal information is properlyprotected from misuse, loss, unauthorized access, modification or disclosure. At the same time, we are committed toproviding innovative and interactive experiences, and to being available to audiences on multiple platforms. Some ofthose platforms are not operated or controlled by Alpha2 OTT, and our ability to protect your personalinformation is limited.

We encourage you to be vigilant about the protection of your own personal information when using third party digitalservices (such as social media platforms). As far as reasonably practicable, we will make sure that our relationshipswith those third parties include appropriate protection of your privacy.

7. Credit Card Information

Your credit card details are only stored and transmitted in encrypted form. Unencrypted credit card information is NOTstored on our internet servers. Online credit card payments are currently processed using a third party paymentgateway service. Credit card information is never stored in a cookie.

If you use PayPal to complete your transaction, your personal information (including credit card information) will becollected and used by PayPal. For more information, you can read the PayPal Privacy Policy.

8. Privacy complaints and enquiries

Alpha2 OTT welcomes feedback about privacy issues and will attend to all questions and complaints promptly.You can contact the Alpha2 OTT about any privacy issues as follows:

By email: support@pixellot.tv
